memberOf.label: are a member of

name.label: are named
name.helpText: Enter term(s) to be found within the title or name of the Person or Group. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

subjectOfSet.label: are the subject of
subjectOfSet.helpText: Search for People & Groups that are the subject of the specified Collections.

professionalActivity.label: carried out professional activity categorized as
professionalActivity.helpText: Search for people and groups that carried out professional activities of the given categorization.

text.label: contain, anywhere in the record
text.helpText: Search for People & Groups by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

produced.label: created
produced.helpText: Search for People & Groups that created the specified Objects.

created.label: created
created.helpText: Search for People & Groups that authored or created the specified Works.

endDate.helpText: Search for People & Groups by the date on which they died or were dissolved.

hasDigitalImage.helpText: Search for People & Groups for which digital images are available.

text.label: contain, anywhere in the record
text.helpText: Search for Concept & Types by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

id.label: have a LUX URI of
id.helpText: Search for Concept or Type terms by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

recordType.label: have a concept class of
recordType.helpText: Search for records categorized as either a "Measurement Unit", "Language", "Material", "Currency" or a "General Concept". Measurement Units are Concepts that are used as the unit of a measurement, such as inches, seconds, kilograms or bytes. Languages are Concepts that represent human-spoken languages, such as English, Spanish or Latin. Materials are Concepts that represent a class of physical material, such as bronze, paper, or agate. Currencies are Concepts that represent monetary currencies, such as dollars, euros, or francs. General Concepts are Concepts that represent more general ideas or subjects, which excludes the more specific classes of Measurement Unit, Language, Material, and Currency.

hasDigitalImage.label: have a digital image available
hasDigitalImage.helpText: Search for Concept and Type terms for which digital images are available.

identifier.label: have an external authority identifier of
identifier.helpText: Search for Concept or Type terms by a string identifier or an external authority URI, such as AAT, LCSH or wikidata.

text.helpText: Search for Events by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

endDate.helpText: Search for Events by the date on which they ended.

id.label: have a LUX URI of
id.helpText: Search for Events by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

recordType.label: have an event class of
recordType.helpText: Search for records categorized as either a "Period" or an "Activity". Periods are Events that have the class of Period, which consists of a Time Period, as opposed to other human-caused activities. Activities are Events that have the class of Activity, which consists of events such as Exhibitions or other collections-related activities.

identifier.label: have an external authority identifier of
identifier.helpText: Search for Events by a string identifier, such as an Accession Number, or an external authority URI, such as VIAF or wikidata.

influenced.label: influenced the creation of
influenced.helpText: Search for Events that influenced the specified Concepts.

startDate.label: started on
startDate.helpText: Search for Events by the date on which they started.

used.helpText: Search for Events which used the specified records.

carriedOutBy.label: were carried out by
carriedOutBy.helpText: Search for Events that were carried out by the specified People & Groups.

memberOf.label: are a member of
memberOf.helpText: Search for Objects that are members of the specified Collection, Exhibition or Archive.

classification.helpText: Search for Objects that are categorized with the specified Concept or Type terms.

material.label: are made of a material

name.label: are named
name.helpText: Enter term(s) to be found within the title or name of the Object. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

subjectOfWork.label: are the subject of
subjectOfWork.helpText: Search for Objects that are the subject of the specified Works.

subjectOfSet.label: are the subject of
subjectOfSet.helpText: Search for Objects that are the subject of the specified Collections.

carries.label: carry or show
carries.helpText: Search for Objects that include the specified Works. Use this option to include additional criteria from Works records in your search.

text.label: contain, anywhere in the record
text.helpText: Search for Objects by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

id.label: have a LUX URI of
id.helpText: Search for Objects by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

hasDigitalImage.label: have a digital image available
hasDigitalImage.helpText: Search for Objects for which digital images are available.

identifier.label: have an external authority URI of
identifier.helpText: Search for Objects by a string identifier or an external authority URI, such as LCSH, BNF or wikidata.

recordType.label: have an object class of
recordType.helpText: Search for records categorized as either a "Physical Object" or a "Digital Object". Physical Objects are physical items, such as paintings, sculptures, fossils and other specimens, and archival objects. Individual physical copies of books are included in this class. Digital Object are digital items, such as internet resources (datasets, e-books, and other digital files). Digitized images of collection items that are physical objects can be found with the “Is Online” facet on Physical Objects.

isOnline.label: have an online version available
isOnline.helpText: Search for Objects with Online Versions.

productionInfluencedBy.label: have creation influenced by
productionInfluencedBy.helpText: Search for Objects that were created with influence by the specified Person or Group

depth.label: have some depth of
depth.helpText: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against the object's depth dimension. The unit is centimeters.

dimension.label: have some dimension of
dimension.helpText: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against each of the object's dimensions. The unit is centimeters.

height.label: have some height of
height.helpText: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against the object's height dimension. The unit is centimeters.

width.label: have some width of
width.helpText: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against the object's width dimension. The unit is centimeters.

producedAt.helpText: Search for Objects that were created at the specified Places.

producedBy.label: were created by
producedBy.helpText: Search for Objects that were created by the specified People & Groups.

producedDate.label: were created on
producedDate.helpText: Search for Objects by the date on which they were created.

producedUsing.label: were created using a technique
producedUsing.helpText: Search for Objects that were created using the specified Technique.

encounteredAt.label: were encountered at
encounteredAt.helpText: Search for Objects that were encountered or found at the specified Place. This is primarily used for Specimens.

encounteredBy.label: were encountered by
encounteredBy.helpText: Search for Objects that were encountered or found by the specified People & Groups. This is primarily used for Specimens.

encounteredDate.label: were encountered on
encounteredDate.helpText: Search for Objects by the date on which they were encountered or found.

classification.helpText: Search for Places that are categorized with the specified Concept or Type terms.

id.label: have a LUX URI of
id.helpText: Search for Places by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

hasDigitalImage.helpText: Search for Places for which digital images are available.

identifier.helpText: Search for Places by a string identifier or an external authority URI, such as TGN, Geonames or wikidata.

id.helpText: Search for Collections by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

hasDigitalImage.helpText: Search for Collections for which digital images are available.

identifier.label: have an external authority URI of
identifier.helpText: Search for Collections by a string identifier or an external authority URI, such as VIAF or wikidata.

createdAt.label: were created at
createdAt.helpText: Search for Collections that were created at the specified Places.

createdBy.label: were created by
createdBy.helpText: Search for Collections that were created by the specified People & Groups.

createdDate.label: were created on
createdDate.helpText: Search for Collections by the date on which they were created. Note the difference with Publication Date.

publishedAt.label: were published at
publishedAt.helpText: Search for Collections that were published at the specified Place. Note the difference with Creation Place, which is where the text was originally created.

publishedBy.label: were published by
publishedBy.helpText: Search for Collections that were published by the specified People & Groups. Note the difference with Creation People & Groups that originally wrote the text or conceived the Collection.

publishedDate.label: were published on
publishedDate.helpText: Search for Collections by the date on which they were published. Note the difference with Creation Date, which is when the collection was originally conceived by its creator.

classification.helpText: Search for Works that are categorized with the specified Concept or Type terms.

isPublicDomain.label: are in the public domain
isPublicDomain.helpText: Search for Works that have been identified as public domain/no copyright materials. Note that this only applies to materials from the Yale University Art Gallery and Yale Center for British Art collections at this time. For copyright questions or more information about rights and re-use of content found in LUX, please contact the appropriate museum or library or consult the Rights and Usage Frequently Asked Questions(Advanced Search Help) linked below.

name.label: are named
name.helpText: Enter term(s) to be found within the title or name of the Work. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

subjectOfWork.label: are the subject of
subjectOfWork.helpText: Search for Works that are the subject of the specified Works.

subjectOfSet.label: are the subject of
subjectOfSet.helpText: Search for Works that are the subject of the specified Collections.

containsWork.label: contain
containsWork.helpText: Search for Works that contain the specified Works.

text.label: contain, anywhere in the record
text.helpText: Search for Works by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

id.label: have a LUX URI of
id.helpText: Search for Works by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

creationCausedBy.label: have a creation caused by
creationCausedBy.helpText: Search for Works that were created because of the specified Events.

creationInfluencedBy.label: have a creation influenced by
creationInfluencedBy.helpText: Search for Works that were created with influence by the specified Person or Group

hasDigitalImage.label: have a digital image available
hasDigitalImage.helpText: Search for Works for which digital images are available.

language.label: have a language of
language.helpText: Search for Works in the specified Language.

recordType.label: have a work class of
recordType.helpText: Search for records categorized as either a "Visual Work" or a "Textual Work. Visual Works are Works that are primarily visual, such as the images shown by paintings or photographs, sculptures, or other non language oriented creative expressions. Textual Works are Works that are primarily textual or otherwise convey information via human language. An Object may include both visual and textual works, such as a poster with graphics and text. In addition, Textual Works encompasses most items from the Library collections, including posters, artworks, musical scores, video and sound recordings.

identifier.label: have an external authority URI of
identifier.helpText: Search for Works by a string identifier, such as a call number, or an external authority URI, such as BNF, DNB or wikidata.

isOnline.label: have an online version available
isOnline.helpText: Search for Works with Online Versions.

createdAt.label: were created at
createdAt.helpText: Search for Works that were created at the specified Places.

createdBy.label: were created by
createdBy.helpText: Search for Works that were authored or created by the specified People & Groups.

createdDate.label: were created on
createdDate.helpText: Search for Works by the date on which they were authored or created. Note the difference with Publication Date.

publishedAt.label: were published at
publishedAt.helpText: Search for Works that were published at the specified Place. Note the difference with Creation Place, which is where the text was originally created.

publishedBy.label: were published by
publishedBy.helpText: Search for Works that were published by the specified People & Groups. Note the difference with Creation People & Groups that originally wrote the text or conceived the work.

publishedDate.label: were published on
publishedDate.helpText: Search for Works by the date on which they were published. Note the difference with Creation Date, which is when the work was originally conceived by its creator.
